alert.note: Alert for Roseau (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 2:52PM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Roseau County. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute and holiday travel. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ongoing blizzard conditions are being reported in the Red River Valley. This will continue for the rest of the afternoon hours. Becoming stranded and being exposed to these conditions for a prolonged period of time today could be life threatening. Significant drifting of snow may lead to dangerous travel and impassable roads.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
